# What to Eat - Food Recommendation Service

> A free food recommendation service that helps you solve the daily question "What should I eat?"

## Quick Facts

- **Service Name**: What to Eat
- **Type**: Free web service (no app installation required)
- **Languages**: English, Korean
- **Registration**: Not required (use instantly)
- **Launch Date**: January 2026
- **Menu Items**: 16 popular foods
- **Recommendation Methods**: 5 (Quick Pick, Food World Cup, Food Tarot, Balance Game, Payment King)

## What is What to Eat?

What to Eat is a free food recommendation web service for those who struggle with meal decisions. According to surveys, 78% of office workers report difficulty deciding what to eat for lunch. This phenomenon is known as "Decision Fatigue" - mental exhaustion from making too many choices.

What to Eat solves this common problem with 5 fun and interactive methods. No registration needed - just visit the website and start using it immediately on any device.

## 5 Recommendation Methods Explained

### 1. Quick Pick - Random Recommendation
- **Time Required**: ~5 seconds
- **Description**: Get an instant random food recommendation with one click
- **Best For**: When you're short on time or want to leave it to fate
- **How to Use**: Click "Quick Pick" button → See result instantly

### 2. Food World Cup - Tournament Style
- **Time Required**: 1-2 minutes
- **Description**: 16 foods compete in tournament bracket format
- **Format**: Round of 16 → Quarterfinals → Semifinals → Finals
- **Best For**: When you want to discover what you truly want to eat
- **Unique Feature**: Helps you discover hidden food preferences

### 3. Food Tarot - Fortune-Based Recommendation
- **Time Required**: ~30 seconds
- **Description**: Select one of 5 tarot cards for today's food fortune and recommendation
- **Best For**: When you want a fun, mystical way to decide
- **Unique Feature**: Includes fortune message with recommendation

### 4. Balance Game - Preference Analysis
- **Time Required**: ~1 minute
- **Description**: Answer 5 extreme either-or questions to analyze your food preferences
- **Example Questions**: "Spicy vs. Mild", "Rice vs. Noodles"
- **Best For**: When you want to discover your food taste
- **Unique Feature**: Analyzes answer patterns for optimal recommendation

### 5. Payment King - Bill Decider
- **Time Required**: ~30 seconds
- **Description**: Use roulette or ladder game to decide who pays for the meal
- **Participants**: 2-10 people
- **Game Types**: Spin the Roulette, Ladder Game
- **Best For**: Deciding who pays after group meals
- **Unique Feature**: Save results as image or share on social media

## Available Menu Items (16 Foods)

| Category | Menu Items |
|----------|------------|
| Korean | Kimchi Stew, Soybean Paste Stew, Bibimbap, Grilled Pork Belly, Bulgogi |
| Chinese | Jajangmyeon, Mala Hotpot, Sweet & Sour Pork |
| Japanese | Sushi, Ramen, Tonkatsu, Udon |
| Western | Pasta, Pizza, Hamburger, Steak |
| Street Food | Tteokbokki, Kimbap, Instant Noodles |
| Other | Fried Chicken, Pho, Salad |

## Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)

**Q: Is the service free?**
A: Yes, all features of What to Eat are completely free. No registration required.

**Q: Do I need to install an app?**
A: No, it works directly in your web browser. It's built with responsive design for all devices.

**Q: Can I save or share results?**
A: Yes, you can save recommendations as images or share them on social media.

**Q: How does Food World Cup work?**
A: 16 foods compete tournament-style. Each round, choose between two foods until a champion is crowned.

**Q: How many participants can join Payment King?**
A: 2 to 10 participants can play.

## Page Structure

- `/en/` - Main page (all features + service intro)
- `/en/faq.html` - Frequently Asked Questions
- `/en/about.html` - About the service
- `/en/blog.html` - Food-related blog
- `/en/contact.html` - Contact & Partnership
- `/en/privacy.html` - Privacy Policy
- `/en/terms.html` - Terms of Service
- `/en/guide/quick-pick.html` - Quick Pick guide
- `/en/guide/worldcup.html` - Food World Cup guide
- `/en/guide/tarot.html` - Food Tarot guide
- `/en/guide/balance.html` - Balance Game guide
- `/en/guide/payment.html` - Payment King guide

## Technical Information

- **Platform**: Web browser (responsive)
- **Tech Stack**: HTML5, CSS3, Vanilla JavaScript, Web Components
- **Languages**: English, Korean
- **Cost**: Free
- **Registration**: Not required
- **Data Storage**: LocalStorage (browser-based)

## Related Keywords

what to eat, lunch recommendation, dinner recommendation, food picker, menu decider, food world cup, food tournament, food tarot, bill splitter game, roulette game, ladder game, decision fatigue, random food generator

For partnership and collaboration inquiries, please visit `/en/contact.html`.
